text: - So check this out:

It's Trevor James, and I
live in Sichuan in Chengdu,

the land of the spiciest
food in the world.
And I've made a list of my top five

favorite meals that
you've gotta try in 2016.
This is my year in review.
Check it out.
So let's start off with number five:
You have to try this!
This beauty is a grilled carp that I ate
with a local friend here in Chengdu.

Now this isn't just any
old regular fish though,
it's On the Paper grilled fish.
Let me tell you, it's delicious.

This is the super garlicy
and super spicy version
and it comes simmering in this
oily and garlicy heavenly juice
that's full of peanuts and huge chunks
of garlic and vegetables.
That's just the beginning though.

The second stage involves
bringing your chosen ingredients,

the ones that you ordered
in a fish infused oil

that's simmering and just
boils those flavors through.
Wow, it's so juicy!
Moving on to number four:

This one is actually two
ducks that you have to try.
I couldn't decide between them,
because one is sweet and one is salty.
Eating each duck involves a day trip

outside of Chengdu to
taste the local specialty.

The first was a pung jo
salted and marinated duck

that was introduced to me
by a local duck master.
It surprisingly tastes exactly like ham,

and it brought me to a
new plateau of heaven.
The next duck is the Lesshan Tianpiya
found in the town with the largest
stone-carved Buddha in the world.

But that's not what you
should come here for.
Nope, you gotta come here for the duck.

This duck is literally
translated as sweet skinned duck.
It's so sweet, so succulent and silky,

plump, fatty, slightly
barbequey bite into a new realm.
The pure definition of life!
On to number three:

Now this was a true treat,
enter Firewood Chicken.

My taste buds were blown
from pure pleasure.

And, I also had the pleasure
of enjoying this meal

with three very nice
young ladies from Sichuan.
Can't complain.

The concept is simple, start
with a fire under a wok,
boil an entire chopped chicken,
inside a broth that's spicy heaven.
Mainly consisting of a bunch of Sichuan

broad bean paste, dried
chilies, ginger, garlic and oil.
Add a bunch of vegetables, boil,

and in the true essence,
add some flat bread

to the side of the wok
until they're crispy
on the outside and gooey on the inside.
Gathered around the wok, we dip the bread
with the juice over and over.

Until we were so full
from bread and chicken
called it a night.
- (Chinese)
- (Chinese)
- It's (bleep)ing awesome.
Now for number two:
This is actually an entire casual meal
that you can have in Urumqi
in Xinjiang province of far-west China.
Three things: pumpkin and lamb steam buns,
lamb kebabs and a famous,
juicy diced lamb and onion rounang.
Surprisingly, I found the lamb kebabs
in Turkey to be better than they are here.
But here what really shined was the
pumpkin and lamb juicy steamed buns.
Just so plump and juicy, with a thin skin

and they pop when your
teeth sink into them.

Order these, combined with
the lamb and onion rounang.

It's basically a stuffed
naan-style Xinjiang bread,
it's going to make you contemplate moving
to Xinjiang just to eat them.
And now for the moment of truth,
a once in a lifetime experience.
On New Year's Day, 2015,

I was invited for lunch
with a local Tibetan family

in western Sichuan at the
Four Girls Mountain Range.
The menu was diverse and hearty,
and was shared in a little living room
heated by a wood stove.

As a mountain lover and food
lover, I was in pure heaven.
But most of all, I was most grateful
for the chance to meet and chat with
these local people from the region
who still live a traditional lifestyle.

Over Tibetan yak butter
tea, blood sausage,

spicy yak meat and hand-picked
local greens and mushrooms,

we discussed what life is like
in the mountains for them.

One thing is for sure, I won't
ever forget this experience.

So if there's something
you've seen in my videos
that you think should have been here,
leave me a comment down below,
or really a comment about anything.
I love hearing from you.

So make sure to click
that subscribe button

if you haven't already
and click like as well.
Thanks again.
